Guides.Title: Ordering Bubble Tea
Guides.Description: Bubble tea is a deeply customizable drink, where you can choose sweetness, richness, temperature, and more.

Pages.Title: Select tea base and flavoring
Pages.Description: True to its name, bubble tea has tea in it. Popular options are black or green tea. A flavoring is optional syrup added in.

Pages.Title: Select sweetness
Pages.Description: Even at places without this step listed, you can ask for a less sweet drink. Usually you can give a percentage, such as 60% sweet.

Pages.Title: Select milk
Pages.Description: Adding milk to your tea makes it a richer, creamier drink. Without milk, bubble tea is refreshing and light. Both are popular!

Pages.Title: Select temperature
Pages.Description: Almost all teas can be made either cool or hot. However, tea without milk often tastes weird hot.

Pages.Title: If cool, select ice
Pages.Description: Asking for no ice means you get more tea, as the ice does not fill the container.

Pages.Title: Select toppings
Pages.Description: The most popular topping is bubbles, chewy tapioca balls. Other popular choices include egg pudding, popping bubbles, and jelly.

Pages.Title: Stab top with straw
Pages.Description: On the go, bubble tea always comes in a sealed plastic cup. To drink, stab the top with a straw. Choose a straw that can fit your topping.
